A framework for Model-Driven Engineering.DT Definition: dynamic virtual model of a system, processor, or service, with data (e.g., sensor data) from physical systems or processes integrated into it.; "Software digital twins representations provide a key abstraction, providing an agile interface on hardware components, capturing operational behaviours of physical assets and processes, also providing refined and interpreted data, to enable diagnoses, predictive maintenance tasks, process plannings, process optimizations, virtual prototyping, and simulation."
A framework for Model-Driven Engineering.purpose of DT: mirror items for monitoring and control operations
A framework for Model-Driven Engineering.purpose /expected benefit of using model: formal specification of information in the form of models allows the application of MDE techniques (model transformations)
A framework for Model-Driven Engineering.Authors: Parri J.; Patara F.; Sampietro S.; Vicario E.

Concept of a Modular and System Model Dr.DT Definition:
It is generally defined as a concept in which operational data from a physical counterpart is processed within models to give recommendations towards a user or the system itself. Other components include its bidirectional orientation [9] as well as its 
real time capabilities [15].
Concept of a Modular and System Model Dr.purpose of DT:
"Digital Twins must be utilized to solve problems 
and generate benefits."
Concept of a Modular and System Model Dr.purpose /expected benefit of using model:
"System models can help to 
visualize this complexity and at the same time being utilized to 
define this behaviour in a machine-readable context, such as 
shown in [26]. "

Meta-model-based shop-floor digital twin.DT Definition:
"DT is considered a new paradigm of modeling and simulationtechnology, extending the use of models to all stages of the product"; the Shop-floor Digital Twin (SDT), as the digital counterpart of physical entities including the humans, machines, material, methods and environments in the existing shop-floor, mirrors the physical shop-floor behavior and performance in the virtual space. The digital counterpart is comprised of a series of semantic digital models and simulation models of the physical shop-floor and has the automatic data synchronization between the physical and virtual space. By establishing the automatic data flow between the physical shop-floor and digital counterpart, the semantic digital models and simulation 
models could be converted to digital shadow and further evolved into SDT.
Meta-model-based shop-floor digital twin.purpose of DT: Provide Self-Adapation/Optimization based on (i) data from PT, (ii) operations offered by the PT; "DT has a strong vitality in the whole product lifecycle and could provide strong support for the digital and intelligent transformation of manufacturing industry in the aspects of virtual model construction and cyber-physical information fusion."
Meta-model-based shop-floor digital twin.Authors: Yang X.; Liu X.; Zhang H.; Fu L.; Yu Y.

Proof of Concept for a Roundtrip Enginee.DT Definition: "The concept of Digital Twin is reserved for denoting a digital representation which is fully integrated with its Physical Twin (i.e. data flow between the physical object and the digital object in both directions) [4]. Likewise, we understand the Digital Twin as a software component that is i) model and data driven (it gets inputs from both cyber and physical objects; i.e., it can be a model that gets input from another model or from a physical object) and ii) can control physical devices (can operate on them). "
Proof of Concept for a Roundtrip Enginee.Publication Title: 2022 24th International Symposium on Symbolic and Numeric Algorithms for Scientific Computing (SYNASC)
Proof of Concept for a Roundtrip Enginee.Authors: A. Chi?; A. -M. Ghiran; R. A. Buchmann

Supporting the Implementation of Digital.DT Definition:
"This work considers two main features of a digital twin system: (1) the representation and storage of the characteristics of real-world entities in a structured form, and (2) the runtime synchronisation between digital and real-world entities."; "A Digital Twin (DT) is a virtual representation of real-world entities (physical objects and systems, or immaterial things that exist over a significant time span) and processes (events or activities that occur in time), synchronised at a specified frequency and fidelity
[1]. It connects with the physical part allowing data transfer from the physical to the digital part and vice versa, in such a way that it can represent, simulate, or predict changes in the physical system."
Supporting the Implementation of Digital.purpose of DT: "This work considers two main features of a digital twin system: (1) the representation and storage of the characteristics of real-world entities in a structured form, and (2) the runtime synchronisation between digital and real-world entities."

Closed-Loop Systems Engineering (CLOSE):.DT Definition: A DT is—from a structural, functional, and behavioural point-of-view—a oneto-one virtual representation of a real world artefact (such as a machine, a component, or objects from the environment) and comprises models of their “data” (geometry, structure, etc.), functionality (data processing, behaviour, etc.), and communication interfaces [35]. EDTs combine the DT idea with modelling and simulation techniques to “bring DTs to life”, they become “experimentable” [36]. VTBs provide an interactive run-time environment for EDTs that allow for the simulation of networks of interacting EDTs [5].
Closed-Loop Systems Engineering (CLOSE):.Authors: M. D. Maio; G. -D. Kapos; N. Klusmann; L. Atorf; U. Dahmen; M. Schluse; J. Rossmann
